file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 26-21-06-04 - ENGINE DISCHARGE PIPING - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL ENGINE DISCHARGE PIPING - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the engine fire-extinguishing tubing. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ENGINE FIRE-EXTINGUISHING TUBING - ALL 26-21-06-000-801-A REMOVAL ENGINE FIRE-EXTINGUISHING TUBING - ALL 26-21-06-400-801-A INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 26-21-06 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 26-21-06-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. ENGINE FIRE-EXTINGUISHING TUBING - REMOVAL A. General (1) These procedures are applicable to the LH and RH engines. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 71-00-00/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES AMM TASK 71-11-01-000-801-A/400 ENGINE UPPER COWLING - REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 412 Upper cowling LH engine 422 Upper cowling RH engine D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Workstand To get access to the engine 1 available F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Engine I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A WARNING: BEFORE YOU DO THE TASK, OBEY THE SAFETY PRECAUTIONS GIVEN IN AMM MPP 71-00-00/200 TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO MATERIAL. (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the circuit breakers below and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to them. • START 1/2. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 26-21-06 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Put the workstand in the work area. (3) Remove the upper cowling (AMM TASK 71-11-01-000-801-A/400) to get access to the engine. J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Remove the bolts, washers and nuts which attach the fire extinguishing tubing to the engine supports. (2) Remove the tubing (1) from the flared reducer (2). (3) Remove the hose (4) and the tubing (1) from the flared tee (3). (4) Remove the engine fire-extinguishing tubing from the engine. (5) Install protection caps to the disconnected points. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 26-21-06 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Engine Fire-Extinguishing Tubing - Removal/Installation Figure 401 ZONE 410 420 2 A C DET. B D 1 C B DET. A E 1 1 F ENGINE SUPPORT 2. FLARED 1. TUBING REDUCER DET. C (TYPICAL) 1 DET. D 4. HOSE 1. TUBING DET. F (TYPICAL) 3. FLARED TEE 1 TORQUE: 56.5 TO 67.8 Nm (500 TO 600 lb.in) DET. E 2 TORQUE: 27.1 TO 31.6 Nm (240 TO 280 lb.in) 145AMM710049.MCE B EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 26-21-06 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 26-21-06-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. ENGINE FIRE-EXTINGUISHING TUBING - INSTALLATION A. General (1) These procedures are applicable to the LH and RH engines. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 71-00-00/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES AMM TASK 71-11-01-400-801-A/400 ENGINE UPPER COWLING - INSTALLATION C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 412 Upper cowling LH engine 422 Upper cowling RH engine D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Workstand To get access to the engine 1 available F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Engine I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A WARNING: BEFORE YOU DO THE TASK, OBEY THE SAFETY PRECAUTIONS GIVEN IN AMM MPP 71-00-00/200 TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO MATERIAL. (1) Before you install the engine fire-extinguishing tubing, make sure that the tubing assembly is clean. (2) Remove the protection caps from the disconnected points, if applicable. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 26-21-06 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Install the tubing (1) from the flared reducer (2). (4) Install the hose (4) and the tubing (1) from the flared tee (3). (5) Install the bolts, washers and nuts which attach the fire extinguishing tubing to the engine supports. (6) Tighten the bolts, nuts and hose. J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Install the upper cowling (AMM TASK 71-11-01-400-801-A/400). (2) Remove the workstand. (3) On the circuit breaker panel, close the circuit breakers below and remove the DO- NOT-CLOSE tag from them: • START 1/2. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 26-21-06 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
